workflow.name: Generate client proposals with OpenAI, Google Sheets, Slides, Gmail, and Drive
workflow.description:
## üßæ AI Proposal Generator Engine

An n8n-based automation that generates client proposals from a form, lets you review everything in one place, and sends the proposal only when you approve it.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è What It Does

The AI Proposal Generator Engine creates proposals directly from an **n8n Form**.
All proposal content and a draft email are generated automatically using OpenAI.

**Google Sheets is used only as a database**, where you:

* Review the generated proposal
* Review the draft email
* Control when the proposal is sent by updating the status

No proposal is sent until it is manually marked as `READY`.

---

## üí° Use Cases

| Use Case              | Description                                                |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| Sales Calls           | Generate proposals immediately after a call using the form |
| Freelancers           | Create clean, repeatable proposals without manual writing  |
| Agencies              | Standardize proposals while keeping them client-specific   |
| Approval Flow         | Review proposal and email before sending                   |
| Fast Turnaround Deals | Reduce proposal creation time from hours to minutes        |
| Team Workflows        | Use Sheets as a simple approval and tracking layer         |

---

## üîß Setup

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Google Credentials

Go to Google Cloud Console and create a Web App (OAuth).

Enable these APIs:

* Google Sheets
* Google Drive
* Gmail

In n8n, select this Google credential inside:

* Google Sheets nodes
* Google Drive nodes
* Gmail nodes

Use the same credential everywhere.

---

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Google Drive Structure

Create this folder setup in Google Drive. You can use the provided templates or your own.

```
Proposal Generator Engine/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 1 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 2 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 3 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Proposal Generation Tracker (Sheets)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Generated Proposals/
```

---

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ Google Sheets Node

Open the **Proposal Generation Tracker** and copy the Sheet ID from the URL.

Paste this ID into the Google Sheets node in n8n.
This sheet is used only to:

* Store generated proposal links
* Store email drafts
* Control send status

---

### 4Ô∏è‚É£ Slides and Drive Nodes

Copy the Slides template ID you want to use and paste it into the **Copy Template** node.

Copy the folder ID of **Generated Proposals** and paste it into the **Move File / Folder** field.

---

### 5Ô∏è‚É£ OpenAI Key

Create an OpenAI credential in n8n using your API key.

Select this credential in all GPT nodes.
You can edit prompts to match your proposal style and tone.

---

## üîÅ Workflow Summary

1. Proposal details are collected using an **n8n Form**
2. OpenAI generates structured proposal content
3. A Google Slides template is copied and filled
4. A proposal email draft is generated
5. Proposal link and email draft are saved in Google Sheets with status `WAITING`
6. You review the proposal and email
7. Status is changed to `READY`
8. Proposal is converted to PDF and sent via Gmail
9. Proposal is stored in Google Drive and status is updated to `SENT`

---

## üìû Support & Contact

üìß **Email:** [atharvapj5@gmail.com](mailto:atharvapj5@gmail.com)
üîó **LinkedIn:** [https://www.linkedin.com/in/atharva-jaiswal/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/atharva-jaiswal/)
üìÖ **Book a support call:** [https://calendly.com/atharvapj5/30min](https://calendly.com/atharvapj5/30min)

parameters.formDescription: Fill out this form to generate a customized client proposal. The proposal is created automatically based on your inputs, including scope, pricing, and deliverables.

parameters.content:
# AI Proposal Engine
Automatically creates a personalized client proposal from form inputs using Google Slides.

values.content: You generate clear, structured, and professional client proposals based on provided inputs.

=From the provided input, generate the following proposal fields and respond only in valid JSON.

Rules:
Title: generate a concise, professional proposal title (maximum 80 characters).
Client Name: return exactly as provided.

Problem: one short paragraphs, maximum 500 characters.

Solution: one short paragraphs, maximum 500 characters.

Scope: maximum 1100 characters total. Start with a brief overview paragraph, then include a Scope section using bullet points, followed by a Deliverables section using a numbered list.

Timeline: concise statement, maximum 100 characters.

Need: bullet points only, maximum 200 characters total.

Price: return exactly as provided.

Payment Link: return exactly as provided.

Output format:
Return a single JSON object with these exact keys:
ClientName, Problem, Solution, Scope, Timeline, Need, Price, PaymentLink

Do not include explanations, markdown, or extra text.

=Example Output
[{
  "Title": "AI UGC Production System Proposal",
  "ClientName": "Aryan Maheshwari",
  "Problem": "SaaS companies need high volumes of ad creatives each month, but current UGC production methods are slow, inconsistent, and expensive. At roughly $15 per video, scaling to 30‚Äì50 videos per client becomes unrealistic.

Existing AI tools do not maintain character consistency, do not use structured copywriting frameworks, and rely on generic prompts that do not convert. As a result, creative output is costly, unpredictable, and rarely optimized for performance.",
  "Solution": "Build an internal AI UGC production system that generates SaaS-focused videos for approximately $1.5 per video, making high-volume output affordable and scalable.

Using talking-head models such as HeyGen, the system maintains strong character consistency while leveraging copywriting formulas, web search, and client briefing documents to create scripts designed to convert. The pipeline supports batch generation, reliable quality, and automated delivery.",
  "Scope": "Overview:
Build an automated system that generates SaaS-style UGC videos at scale by combining script generation, AI actors, voice synthesis, and automated storage. The system runs with minimal manual effort, supports multiple clients, and produces batches of videos efficiently.

Scope:
- Script generation pipeline based on defined copywriting frameworks
- Automated video generation using the HeyGen API
- Storage workflow organized by client and date
- Dashboard or database to manage clients, scripts, frameworks, and video links
- Automated updates to the database with generated video links
- Basic monitoring and error handling
- Batch generation support for multiple scripts and videos per run
- Integration of all tools into a unified automated workflow

Deliverables:
1. n8n workflow for end-to-end automation
2. UGC video generation system covering script and video pipelines
3. Configured and integrated apps including Airtable, Google Sheets, HeyGen, Google Drive, Google Docs, and GPT-5 inside the workflow
4. Loom walkthrough video demonstrating how the system works",
  "Timeline": "3‚Äì5 days after starting the contract",
  "Need": "- N8N workspace access and permissions
- Drive folders for video storage
- Brand and client briefing documents
- Airtable or Google Sheets access
- HeyGen API access and credentials",
  "Price": "2532 USD",
  "PaymentLink": "https://wise.com/pay/r/9T0HFkPOD2TicpU"
}]
only output like this do not output in markdown should not have ```json
everything in json should be string
You write warm, professional proposal emails that clearly explain value, build trust, and guide the client toward the next step.

=From the provided Proposal Info, write a short, warm, and professional proposal email on behalf of Dragomagte.

Instructions:

Write the email as Atharva from Dragomagte.

Keep it concise, friendly, and confident.

Start with a light hook that references the client‚Äôs problem or goal.

Briefly summarize the problem and how the proposed solution addresses it.

Clearly state that the proposal is attached (PFA) for review.

Mention that the payment link is included inside the proposal.

End with a clear next step (review, questions, or confirmation to proceed).

Output format:
Return only valid JSON with these exact keys:
subject, body

Rules:

Do NOT include markdown

Do NOT include ```json

Do NOT include explanations or extra text

Use natural line breaks in the email body

Return a single JSON object (not an array)

Input:
Proposal Info: {{ $('Generate Proposal Data').first().json.output[0].content[0].text }}

Sample Output:
[{
"subject": "Proposal for AI UGC Production System",
"body": "Hi Gilles,\n\nFollowing up on our discussion around scaling UGC content efficiently, I‚Äôve attached the proposal outlining the AI UGC Production System tailored to your needs.\n\nThe proposal covers the current challenges with cost and consistency, the proposed solution, scope of work, timeline, and next steps. You‚Äôll also find the payment link included inside the proposal for convenience.\n\nPlease review the attached proposal and let me know if you have any questions or would like any adjustments. Once confirmed, I can proceed right away.\n\nBest regards,\nAtharva\nDragomagte"
}]

parameters.content:
## üìÑ AI Proposal Generator Engine

The AI Proposal Generator Engine is a simple system built to create client proposals very quickly ‚ö°. After a sales call, once the requirements are clear, you can enter key details like client information, scope, pricing, and even the call transcript so the system understands the full context of the conversation.

Using these inputs, the engine automatically creates a fully customized proposal using a predefined template and also prepares a draft email. Everything is saved in a central sheet for review. When the proposal is marked as ready, the system converts it into a PDF and sends it to the client automatically. The main focus of this engine is speed and reducing manual work while keeping proposals accurate and consistent.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Proposal Generator Engine ‚Äì Setup Guide 

This guide shows how to set up the workflow so proposals can be created and sent automatically.

---

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Google Credentials

Go to Google Cloud Console and create a Web App (OAuth).

Enable these APIs:

* Google Sheets
* Google Drive
* Gmail

In n8n, select this Google credential inside:

* Google Sheets nodes
* Google Drive nodes
* Gmail nodes

Use the same credential everywhere.

---

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Google Drive Structure

Create this folder setup in Google Drive. You can use the provided templates or your own.

```
Proposal Generator Engine/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 1 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 2 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template 3 (Slides)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Proposal Generation Tracker (Sheets)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Generated Proposals/
```

---

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ Google Sheets Node

Open the Proposal Generation Tracker and copy the Sheet ID from the URL.

Paste this ID into the Google Sheets node in n8n.
This sheet is used to read data and control when a proposal is sent.

---

### 4Ô∏è‚É£ Slides and Drive Nodes

Copy the Slides template ID you want to use and paste it into the Copy Template node.

Copy the folder ID of Generated Proposals and paste it into the Move File or Move Folder field.

---

### 5Ô∏è‚É£ OpenAI Key

Create an OpenAI credential in n8n using your API key.

Select it in all GPT nodes and adjust the prompts if needed.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
